posts.post_content:
[Urza's Bauble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urza's Bauble)  
[Mishra's Bauble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Bauble)  
[Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith)  
Plus this, and 4 copies of each, and we've got a deck that virtually has only 44 cards.   
  
Of course, you could push it even further, with 4 [Serum Visions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serum Visions), 4 [ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ponder)s, 4 [preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=preordain)s, 4 [brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=brainstorm)s and you've got only 28 cards left, less than half of an ordinary deck.  
  
With 12 islands, that leaves 4 copies of your 4 favorite cards. My choices would probably be [opt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=opt), [peek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=peek), [sorcerous sight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sorcerous sight), and [visions of beyond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=visions of beyond).  
  
There, a perfect 60 card deck.
posts.html:
Urza's Bauble
Mishra's Bauble
Street Wraith
Plus this, and 4 copies of each, and we've got a deck that virtually has only 44 cards.

Of course, you could push it even further, with 4 Serum Visions, 4 ponders, 4 preordains, 4 brainstorms and you've got only 28 cards left, less than half of an ordinary deck.

With 12 islands, that leaves 4 copies of your 4 favorite cards. My choices would probably be opt, peek, sorcerous sight, and visions of beyond.

There, a perfect 60 card deck.

posts.post_content: Absolutely insane. On T1 I see thier hand to determine my next play, or decide which discard spell I should use-AND-I get to draw a card. posts.post_content:
@chinkeeyong  
Life is an abundant and replaceable resource, card filtering is a useful effect and well worth a small investment of resources, the added knowledge of your opponent's status is gravy. And that's in a normal situation: with infect running rampant, extra life is less useful than ever.

Posted By: supafly13 (9/5/2011 9:14:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm putting this little sucker in the Ichorid/dredge deck I'm currently building.  
  
Obviously being a mana/card free card is excellent in itself, but being able to check out your opponent's hand with 4 [Cabal Therapy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Therapy) in the deck makes hand desctruction exceptionally viable.  
  
Also, the card draw fuels dredge allowing for a first turn dredge, unlike [Breakthrough](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breakthrough) or [Careful Study](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Careful Study).  
  
And they're so easy to get your hands on!  
  
5/5
posts.html:

And they're so easy to get your hands on!

5/5

Posted By: CptStormCrow (8/28/2011 9:03:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Comparable to [Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith), with a mild extra benefit. (It's not like anyone intends to cast or reanimate Street Wraith.)  
  
I'd say Probe is strictly better (because it adds to Storm count), but Street Wraith fuels [Ichorid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichorid) and can't be countered, so... run both?
